verses.kjv: And the Ziphites came unto Saul to Gibeah, saying, Doth not David hide himself in the hill of Hachilah, which is before Jeshimon?
verses.web: The Ziphites came to Saul to Gibeah, saying, “Doesn’t David hide himself in the hill of Hachilah, which is before the desert?”
verses.ct: The Ziphites went to Saul at Gibeah and told him, "David is hiding on the hill of Hachilah, near the edge of the wilderness."

verses.kjv: Then Saul arose, and went down to the wilderness of Ziph, having three thousand chosen men of Israel with him, to seek David in the wilderness of Ziph.
verses.web: Then Saul arose, and went down to the wilderness of Ziph, having three thousand chosen men of Israel with him, to seek David in the wilderness of Ziph.
verses.ct: So Saul set out for the wilderness of Ziph with 3,000 of Israel's best soldiers to hunt for David there.

verses.kjv: And Saul pitched in the hill of Hachilah, which is before Jeshimon, by the way. But David abode in the wilderness, and he saw that Saul came after him into the wilderness.
verses.web: Saul encamped in the hill of Hachilah, which is before the desert, by the way. But David stayed in the wilderness, and he saw that Saul came after him into the wilderness.
verses.ct: Saul set up camp on the hill of Hachilah, along the road near the wilderness. David was staying in the wilderness, and when he learned that Saul had followed him there,

verses.kjv: David therefore sent out spies, and understood that Saul was come in very deed.
verses.web: David therefore sent out spies, and understood that Saul had certainly come.
verses.ct: he sent out spies and confirmed that Saul had definitely arrived.

verses.kjv: And David arose, and came to the place where Saul had pitched: and David beheld the place where Saul lay, and Abner the son of Ner, the captain of his host: and Saul lay in the trench, and the people pitched round about him.
verses.web: Then David arose, and came to the place where Saul had encamped; and David saw the place where Saul lay, with Abner the son of Ner, the captain of his army. Saul lay within the place of the wagons, and the people were encamped around him.
verses.ct: David crept to the place where Saul had made camp. He spotted where Saul was sleeping, along with Abner son of Ner, the commander of his army. Saul was lying in the center of the camp, with his troops camped all around him.

verses.kjv: Then answered David and said to Ahimelech the Hittite, and to Abishai the son of Zeruiah, brother to Joab, saying, Who will go down with me to Saul to the camp? And Abishai said, I will go down with thee.
verses.web: Then David answered and said to Ahimelech the Hittite, and to Abishai the son of Zeruiah, brother of Joab, saying, “Who will go down with me to Saul to the camp?” Abishai said, “I will go down with you.”
verses.ct: David turned to Ahimelech the Hittite and Abishai son of Zeruiah, Joab's brother, and asked, "Who will go down into Saul's camp with me?" Abishai answered, "I'll go with you."

verses.kjv: So David and Abishai came to the people by night: and, behold, Saul lay sleeping within the trench, and his spear stuck in the ground at his bolster: but Abner and the people lay round about him.
verses.web: So David and Abishai came to the people by night: and, behold, Saul lay sleeping within the place of the wagons, with his spear stuck in the ground at his head; and Abner and the people lay around him.
verses.ct: So David and Abishai slipped into the camp at night. There was Saul, sound asleep in the middle of the camp, with his spear stuck in the ground by his head. Abner and the rest of the soldiers were sleeping all around him.

verses.kjv: Then said Abishai to David, God hath delivered thine enemy into thine hand this day: now therefore let me smite him, I pray thee, with the spear even to the earth at once, and I will not smite him the second time.
verses.web: Then Abishai said to David, “God has delivered up your enemy into your hand today. Now therefore please let me strike him with the spear to the earth at one stroke, and I will not strike him the second time.”
verses.ct: Abishai whispered to David, "God has handed your enemy over to you tonight. Let me pin him to the ground with one thrust of his own spear — I won't need a second."

verses.kjv: And David said to Abishai, Destroy him not: for who can stretch forth his hand against the LORD’s anointed, and be guiltless?
verses.web: David said to Abishai, “Don’t destroy him; for who can stretch out his hand against LORD’s anointed, and be guiltless?”
verses.ct: But David said to Abishai, "Don't kill him. No one can lay a hand on the LORD's anointed and be innocent."

verses.kjv: David said furthermore, As the LORD liveth, the LORD shall smite him; or his day shall come to die; or he shall descend into battle, and perish.
verses.web: David said, “As LORD lives, LORD will strike him; or his day shall come to die; or he shall go down into battle and perish.
verses.ct: David continued, "As surely as the LORD lives, the LORD himself will strike him down — whether his time comes naturally, or he falls in battle.

verses.kjv: The LORD forbid that I should stretch forth mine hand against the LORD’s anointed: but, I pray thee, take thou now the spear that is at his bolster, and the cruse of water, and let us go.
verses.web: LORD forbid that I should stretch out my hand against LORD’s anointed; but now please take the spear that is at his head, and the jar of water, and let’s go.”
verses.ct: The LORD forbid that I should raise my hand against the LORD's anointed. Just grab the spear by his head and the jar of water, and let's get out of here."

verses.kjv: So David took the spear and the cruse of water from Saul’s bolster; and they gat them away, and no man saw it, nor knew it, neither awaked: for they were all asleep; because a deep sleep from the LORD was fallen upon them.
verses.web: So David took the spear and the jar of water from Saul’s head; and they went away: and no man saw it, or knew it, nor did any awake; for they were all asleep, because a deep sleep from LORD had fallen on them.
verses.ct: So David took the spear and the water jar from beside Saul's head, and they slipped away. No one saw them, no one knew, and no one woke up — because the LORD had put them all into a deep sleep.

verses.kjv: Then David went over to the other side, and stood on the top of an hill afar off; a great space being between them:
verses.web: Then David went over to the other side, and stood on the top of the mountain afar off; a great space being between them;
verses.ct: David crossed over to the other side and stood on top of a hill far away, with a wide distance between him and the camp.

verses.kjv: And David cried to the people, and to Abner the son of Ner, saying, Answerest thou not, Abner? Then Abner answered and said, Who art thou that criest to the king?
verses.web: and David cried to the people, and to Abner the son of Ner, saying, “Don’t you answer, Abner?” Then Abner answered, “Who are you who cries to the king?”
verses.ct: David shouted across to the soldiers and to Abner son of Ner, "Aren't you going to answer me, Abner?" Abner called back, "Who are you, shouting at the king?"

verses.kjv: And David said to Abner, Art not thou a valiant man? and who is like to thee in Israel? wherefore then hast thou not kept thy lord the king? for there came one of the people in to destroy the king thy lord.
verses.web: David said to Abner, “Aren’t you a man? Who is like you in Israel? Why then have you not kept watch over your lord, the king? For one of the people came in to destroy the king your lord.
verses.ct: David replied, "You're supposed to be the greatest warrior in Israel, aren't you? Then why didn't you protect your king? Someone snuck into camp tonight to kill him!

verses.kjv: This thing is not good that thou hast done. As the LORD liveth, ye are worthy to die, because ye have not kept your master, the LORD’s anointed. And now see where the king’s spear is, and the cruse of water that was at his bolster.
verses.web: This thing isn’t good that you have done. As LORD lives, you are worthy to die, because you have not kept watch over your lord, LORD’s anointed. Now see where the king’s spear is, and the jar of water that was at his head.”
verses.ct: What you've done is inexcusable. As surely as the LORD lives, you all deserve to die for failing to guard the LORD's anointed. Go ahead — look around. Where is the king's spear? Where is the water jar that was right by his head?"

verses.kjv: And Saul knew David’s voice, and said, Is this thy voice, my son David? And David said, It is my voice, my lord, O king.
verses.web: Saul knew David’s voice, and said, “Is this your voice, my son David?” David said, “It is my voice, my lord, O king.”
verses.ct: Saul recognized David's voice and called out, "Is that you, my son David?" David answered, "It is, my lord the king."

verses.kjv: And he said, Wherefore doth my lord thus pursue after his servant? for what have I done? or what evil is in mine hand?
verses.web: He said, “Why does my lord pursue his servant? For what have I done? What evil is in my hand?
verses.ct: Then David said, "Why does my lord keep chasing his servant? What have I done? What crime am I guilty of?

verses.kjv: Now therefore, I pray thee, let my lord the king hear the words of his servant. If the LORD have stirred thee up against me, let him accept an offering: but if they be the children of men, cursed be they before the LORD; for they have driven me out this day from abiding in the inheritance of the LORD, saying, Go, serve other gods.
verses.web: Now therefore, please let my lord the king hear the words of his servant. If it is so that LORD has stirred you up against me, let him accept an offering. But if it is the children of men, they are cursed before LORD; for they have driven me out today that I shouldn’t cling to LORD’s inheritance, saying, ‘Go, serve other gods!’
verses.ct: Please, my lord the king, hear me out. If the LORD is the one stirring you up against me, then let him accept an offering to settle it. But if it's people who are turning you against me, may they be cursed before the LORD — because they've driven me away from the land the LORD gave his people, basically telling me, 'Go worship other gods.'

verses.kjv: Now therefore, let not my blood fall to the earth before the face of the LORD: for the king of Israel is come out to seek a flea, as when one doth hunt a partridge in the mountains.
verses.web: Now therefore, don’t let my blood fall to the earth away from the presence of LORD; for the king of Israel has come out to seek a flea, as when one hunts a partridge in the mountains.”
verses.ct: So please, don't let my blood be spilled far from the LORD's presence. The king of Israel has come out to hunt a single flea — like someone chasing a partridge through the mountains."

verses.kjv: Then said Saul, I have sinned: return, my son David: for I will no more do thee harm, because my soul was precious in thine eyes this day: behold, I have played the fool, and have erred exceedingly.
verses.web: Then Saul said, “I have sinned. Return, my son David; for I will no more do you harm, because my life was precious in your eyes today. Behold, I have played the fool, and have erred exceedingly.”
verses.ct: Saul replied, "I have sinned. Come back, my son David. I won't try to harm you again, because you valued my life today. I've been a fool — I've made a terrible mistake."

verses.kjv: And David answered and said, Behold the king’s spear! and let one of the young men come over and fetch it.
verses.web: David answered, “Behold the spear, O king! Then let one of the young men come over and get it.
verses.ct: David called back, "Here is the king's spear! Send one of your young men over to get it.

verses.kjv: The LORD render to every man his righteousness and his faithfulness; for the LORD delivered thee into my hand to day, but I would not stretch forth mine hand against the LORD’s anointed.
verses.web: LORD will render to every man his righteousness and his faithfulness; because LORD delivered you into my hand today, and I wouldn’t stretch out my hand against LORD’s anointed.
verses.ct: The LORD rewards everyone according to their righteousness and faithfulness. He delivered you into my hands today, but I refused to raise my hand against the LORD's anointed.

verses.kjv: And, behold, as thy life was much set by this day in mine eyes, so let my life be much set by in the eyes of the LORD, and let him deliver me out of all tribulation.
verses.web: Behold, as your life was respected today in my eyes, so let my life be respected in LORD’s eyes, and let him deliver me out of all oppression.”
verses.ct: Just as I valued your life today, may the LORD value my life and rescue me from every trouble."

verses.kjv: Then Saul said to David, Blessed be thou, my son David: thou shalt both do great things, and also shalt still prevail. So David went on his way, and Saul returned to his place.
verses.web: Then Saul said to David, “You are blessed, my son David. You will both do mightily, and will surely prevail.” So David went his way, and Saul returned to his place.
verses.ct: Saul said to David, "May God bless you, my son David. You will do great things and surely succeed." Then David went on his way, and Saul returned home.
